name: Baccalà Seafood & Wine (London Bridge, Bermondsey Street)
short_title: Refined Italian seafood with a serious wine focus
summary: Baccalà Seafood & Wine is a polished seafood-led Italian restaurant on Bermondsey Street, praised for exceptional ingredients, thoughtful cooking and an outstanding wine programme. It’s often described as a more refined, grown-up alternative to nearby casual pasta spots—ideal for dates, celebrations and wine lovers who enjoy lingering over carefully paired dishes.
what_diners_love: High-quality seafood, fresh and carefully cooked
Excellent wine list with knowledgeable staff and strong by-the-glass options
Top-tier tiramisu frequently described as one of the best in London
Warm, attentive service with personalised wine guidance
Authentic Italian flavours—modern but respectful of tradition
Open-kitchen counter seating downstairs, popular with food lovers
popular_dishes: Salt cod (baccalà), especially whipped or served with polenta
atmosphere_experience: Small, intimate and stylish with counter seating, tables upstairs, and a quieter downstairs kitchen lounge. Noise levels vary (lively upstairs, calmer below). Many diners enjoy watching the chefs at work. Overall it feels relaxed yet refined—suited to dates, anniversaries, business dinners and wine-focused evenings.
good_to_know: Reservations strongly recommended, especially evenings and weekends
Early bookings may come with a set table time
Higher price point than nearby casual Italian spots (often £60–100+ per person)
Large groups may require set menus and pre-orders
Portions are generally well-sized but the overall experience leans fine-dining
Not particularly child-focused; better suited to adults
mixed_feedback: A small number of reviews mention service issues such as feeling rushed late in the evening
Some note rigid handling of large group bookings
top_tip: Let the team guide your wine choices and don’t skip dessert—the tiramisu is a must-order even for people who usually avoid dessert.
